medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive distal leg weakness and gait difficulty.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 22 with progressive weakness and gait difficulties. Over 8 years, the patient experienced complete loss of ambulation, with muscle weakness progressing to facial, neck flexors, and swallowing muscles. Despite severe muscle wasting in limbs and axial muscles, the quadriceps muscle remained strong.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with quadriceps-sparing inclusion body myopathy (QS-IBM) in 1993.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's older brother has the same disease, which began at the age of 21.
